poem:
### Outcry

Green dreams silenced  
amidst discordant calls—  
nonsense rules the day.  
In a flicker of folly,  
invites penned for shadows,  
as wise winds cry  
from corners unseen.  
Foolish hosts foster  
far-right phantoms,  
while quiet seeds yearn  
to sprout.  
The soil,  
torn and scattered,  
whispers secrets of balance,  
in veins of forgotten earth.
